abstractText: The main purpose of the California Department of Water Resources (DWR) Environmental Monitoring Program (EMP) is to provide information about the impacts of river flow regulation and water diversions on water quality and biological organisms, so that mandates specified in California Water Quality Control Plans and Water Right Decisions are met. Phytoplankton represents the base of the food chain and change in the quantity and composition of phytoplankton have bottom-up effects on the regional ecosystem. Therefore, monitoring these changes are critical to managing the entire system.
title: DWR Phytoplankton Collection in San Francisco Bay Delta v1.0
